item.title: Violina add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can warm me, I know that is poetry. If I feel physically as if the top of my head were taken off, I know that is poetry. These are the only ways I know it. Is there any other way?" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Violina add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "It's not true that life is one damn thing after another; it's one damn thing over and over." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Violina add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "To live is so startling it leaves little time for anything else." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Violina add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Nature is a haunted house--but Art--is a house that tries to be haunted." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Violina add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Violina add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "A word is dead when it's been said, some say. I say it just begins to live that day." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Violina add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Violina add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Violina add a quote by A.E. Housman
item.description: "I do not choose the right word, I get rid of the wrong one." -- A.E. Housman

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Think like a wise man but communicate in the language of the people." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Out of the quarrel with others we make rhetoric; out of the quarrel with ourselves we make poetry." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Everything exists, everything is true and the earth is just a bit of dust beneath our feet." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Any fool can fight a winning battle, but it needs character to fight a losing one, and that should inspire us; which reminds me that I dreamed the other night that I was being hanged, but was the life and soul of the party." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "We taste and feel and see the truth. We do not reason ourselves into it." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Violina add a quote by W.B. Yeats
item.description: "What can be explained is not poetry." -- W.B. Yeats

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "The worst thing about some men is that when they are not drunk they are sober." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Hearts are not had as a gift but hearts are earned By those who are not entirely beautiful." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart concealing it will break." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Shakespear
item.description: "There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so." -- William Shakespear

item.title: Violina add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Hell is empty and all the devils are here." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Violina add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
Violina add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "Soar, eat ether, see what has never been seen; depart, be lost, but climb." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Violina add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "You see, I am a poet, and not quite right in the head, darling. It’s only that." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Violina add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "pity me that the heart is slow to learn what the swift mind beholds at every turn." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Violina add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "I am glad that I paid so little attention to good advice; had I abided by it I might have been saved from some of my most valuable mistakes." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Violina add a quote by Edna St.Vincent Millay
item.description: "I shall die but that is all that I shall do for death." -- Edna St.Vincent Millay

item.title: Violina add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "A person who publishes a book willfully appears before the populace with his pants down. If it is a good book nothing can hurt him. If it is a bad book nothing can help him." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay
